title: Arya Zandvakili
text:
orcid
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  
I am a physician, scientist, and infectious disease fellow.
My current research focus is determining how herpes viruses control gene expression.
I love caring for patients. However, healthcare only intervenes after political-economic forces have driven disease; and healthcare objectifies patients for financial gain and resource extraction.

title: Advocacy
text:
I am a proponent of single-payer healthcare financing because:

it is universal (everybody has access to the same benefits)

it is more economical than multi-payer and for-profit health insurance
it reduces financial harm to patients
it reduces bureaucracy

For these reasons, I started a Chapter of “Students for a National Health Program” in medical school and an Iowa chapter of Physicians for a National Health Program.

title: Treating Hepatitis C within Addiction Medicine Clinic
text:
Here we are study the impact of treating hepatitis C within an Addiction Medicine clinic.
Due exorbitant costs, Iowa Medicaid restricts insurance coverage for direct-acting antiviral (DAA) therapy. Until recently Iowa Medicaid only paid for hepatitis C DAAs when prescribed by either Hepatology or Infectious Disease specialists. Recently, this rule was relaxed to allow other clinicians to prescribe DAAs just in “collaboration” with a specialists. This rule-change provided an opportunity for the University of Iowa addiction medicine clinic to prescribe DAAs to their patients with chronic hepatitis C.
For this project, we compared time-to-treatment when the addiction medicine clinicians to treat Hepatitis C directly to referring to a specialists.

title: Deciphering logic embedded in regulatory DNA sequences
text: For my PhD thesis, I used fruitflies (Drosophila melanogaster) as a model to study how arrangement and affinity of transcription factor binding sites affect transcriptional output.

title: Transcriptional control of cytomegalovirus genes
text: For my post-doctoral research project, I am studying the transcriptional control of cytomegalovirus promoters during CMV reactivation.

title: Advocacy
text:
I am a proponent of single-payer healthcare financing because:

it is universal (everybody has access to the same benefits)

it is more economical than multi-payer and for-profit health insurance
it reduces financial harm to patients
it reduces bureaucracy

For these reasons, I started a Chapter of “Students for a National Health Program” in medical school and an Iowa chapter of Physicians for a National Health Program.
